text:
Xiaomi introduced Mi TV 5 Pro - flagship TVs with quantum dot technology
05 Nov 2019, 09:30 by Daria Gromova
They are thinner than the iPhone 11.
At a presentation in China, Xiaomi showed the line of new smart TVs Mi TV 5 Pro in three sizes: 55, 65 and 75 inches. Their QLED displays support HDR10 +, MEMC's smoother image technology, and are capable of reproducing 8K content.
All three models come with 4 GB of RAM and 64 GB of internal memory. The operating system uses Android TV with the PatchWall interface, which recommends content based on what you are watching.



The aluminum case of the 55-inch model has a thickness of only 5.9 mm - for comparison, the thickness of the iPhone 11 is 8.1 mm. The design ‚Äúwithout joints‚Äù corresponds to the overall minimalistic style of Xiaomi technology. Two speakers are responsible for high-quality sound; there is support for Dolby Audio and DTS HD. The set of connectors turned out to be decent: three HDMI, two USB, S / PDIF and Ethernet.
Cost is already known:

55 ‚Äù- 3,699 yuan (‚âà33,400 rubles);
65 ‚Äù- 4,999 yuan (‚âà45 110 rubles);
75 ‚Äù- 9,999 yuan (‚âà90,300 rubles).

Xiaomi also introduced a line of standard Mi TV 5. They differ from the Pro versions only in the absence of Quantum Dot technology and a reduced memory capacity: 3 GB / 32 GB. They are slightly more budget:

55 ‚Äù- 2,999 yuan (‚âà27,080 rubles);
65 ‚Äù- 3,999 yuan (‚âà36,110 rubles);
75 ‚Äù- 7,999 yuan (‚âà72,240 rubles).
